file_content.text: I'm out of here the second the alien prisoners calm down.
Here are the Republic's findings from their domination experiment.
Yes, this is it! Look, they even called the tests "Project Noble Focus"--how rich!
Thank you for this. Humans must stick together. I'll make sure Darth Malgus hears of your cooperation.
I'm glad to see an alien act nobly. You're a hero to your kind, and to the Empire. Darth Malgus will hear of your help.
Finally we'll learn the Republic's secrets, and I can be rid of these wretched prisoners. On behalf of Darth Malgus, I thank you.
I can hear the aliens' howls. Please, recover those experiment results soon.
The aliens! Did you see them? Tearing everyone to pieces?
They're frenzied, bloodthirsty, tore through my military escort in half a minute. I didn't know aliens could be so, so violent!
Can't you leave Belsavis?
I have no choice. I'm here on Darth Malgus's orders.
Those freaks love terrorizing the superior species.
Typical alien behavior.
I know, but this is worse than usual.
These aliens are angry after years of imprisonment. Don't hold their example against the rest of us.
We're not all that violent.
Of course, I didn't mean any--I'm just not used to field research.
They can't reach you here.
I know but--well, it's good you're here. Captain Vandorn's been undressing me with his eyes ever since I arrived.
I'll protect you from the ferocious aliens.
[Flirt] You're safe with me.
Thank you. Captain Vandorn just ignored me, but it's good to know someone cares.
I shouldn't even be here, but Darth Malgus insisted. He said my task pertains to the Empire's future.
These alien gangs are pawns in a Republic-engineered domination experiment; forced to fight each other in the name of Republic science.
Knowledge of certain species' strengths and weaknesses could prove vital in the coming war. I'm surprised we didn't think of it first.
A useful experiment.
Yes, my lord. Darth Malgus actually sent me here to eliminate their head start.
They usually shy away from questionable experiments. How far the Republic's come.
I underestimated the Republic.
Yes, my lord. How far indeed.
The Republic would never authorize such cruel experiments, no matter how useful the findings.
Sounds like a rogue operation.
That would certainly explain hiding the tests on Belsavis.
They know that to defeat your enemy is to know how they fight. You Imps should've conducted your own tests years ago.
The Republic isn't stupid.
I appreciate the tip, but Darth Malgus sent me to rectify our information gap.
The Republic wouldn't do that.
I was skeptical too, but facts are facts. I'd suspect they're analyzing the aliens for weaknesses.
How barbaric.
I know. To think they beat us to the research!
With the Republic's findings, we'd have months, maybe years' worth of insight into alien behavior. Plus we could expose the Republic's dirty secret.
I hate to ask, but--I can't go back out there. Could you retrieve the Republic's domination experiment research?
The research will be ours.
It's a possibility.
Thank you! It's about time we know what the Republic's been working on.
Only if you can afford me.
I have the funds. Get me the Republic's research, and it's all yours.
I'm too busy. [Refuse quest]
Just what Captain Vandorn said. Sorry to bother you.
I'm not fit for this madness.
